name: host_raid_disk_failure
description: Host RAID Disk Failure is an incident type that occurs when at least one device in a RAID array fails. This can result in a loss of data or service interruption. The incident requires attention and possibly a disk swap to restore the RAID array and prevent further failures.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Host RAID Disk Failure
Host RAID Disk Failure is an incident type that occurs when at least one device in a RAID array fails. This can result in a loss of data or service interruption. The incident requires attention and possibly a disk swap to restore the RAID array and prevent further failures.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check if the system recognizes the RAID array

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `cat /proc/mdstat`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the disks status in the RAID array

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `mdadm --detail /dev/md${RAID_DEVICE}`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the SMART status of all disks in the RAID array

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `smartctl -a /dev/${DISK_DEVICE}`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the logs for disk errors

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `dmesg | grep -i "hard error"`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check the system logs for disk errors

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `grep -i "I/O error" /var/log/messages`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the RAID events log

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `cat /var/log/messages | grep -i "mdadm"`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the disk health using S.M.A.R.T

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `smartctl -H /dev/${DISK_DEVICE}`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the filesystem consistency on the RAID array

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `fsck /dev/md${RAID_DEVICE}`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check the RAID array integrity and rebuild status

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `mdadm --detail /dev/md${RAID_DEVICE}`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## Check the partitions on the RAID array

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `lsblk`

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Replace the failed disk in the RAID array and rebuild the array.

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_replace_disk_rebuild_array($BACKUP_FILE, $FAILED_DISK, $NEW_DISK, $NUMBER_OF_DISKS)
